title: Micronema 10ML Liquid
details: This medication may be used to relieve occasional constipation
precautions: Before using it, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of serious loss of body water (dehydration), high/low levels of certain minerals in the blood (such as potassium, calcium, sodium, phosphate), kidney disease, current stomach/abdominal symptoms (such as pain, cramping, persistent nausea/vomiting), bowel problems (such as blockage, ulcerative colitis, hemorrhoids), laxative use for constipation in the past week, heart disease (such as heart failure, irregular heartbeat), liver disease, sodium-restricted diet. Tell your doctor right away if the enema tip causes rectal bleeding/pain, if you do not have a bowel movement within 30 minutes of using the product, if you have symptoms of dehydration, or if you think you may have a serious medical problem. Some products that may interact with this drug include other drugs that may affect the kidneys(including ACE inhibitors such as lisinopril, ARBs such as valsartan, diuretics/"water pills" such as furosemide/hydrochlorothiazide, NSAIDs such as ibuprofen/naproxen).
effects: Mild abdominal discomfort/cramps or gas may occur. If any of these effects persist or worsen, tell your doctor or pharmacist promptly.

precautions: Following Colic drops, precautions should be followed while taking it.Before taking this medicine,  you should inform the doctor about your previous medical history. Thus, inform your doctor if you have any hypersensitivity problems from any of the ingredients present in this medicine. Although there is limited data available about the use of colic drops in pregnancy, however, from the available data and doctor's reviews, it is known that this medicine is not assigned in the pregnancy condition. title: Fibo Sachet 1x10 (L)
details:
This medication is used for the treatment of constipation. It makes the stool easier to pass out. It increases the movement of intestinal muscles and makes the defecation process easier. Fibo sachet contains fibre that increases the bulk in stool

READ MORE
precautions: If you are sensitive to some substances, then it is better to discuss the product with the doctor before taking it in order to avoid any harmful effects of the product. The product may contain harmful ingredients that are not suitable for you.If you have some medical history related to intestine, stomach or intestinal blockage, then it is better to take the product with a doctor's consultation.The product may contain glucose. If you are suffering from diabetes, then it is preferable to discuss the product with the doctor before taking it.Do not take the product for longer periods because it can make the intestinal walls softer, and also it may cause severe diarrhoea.Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of, Stomach/intestinal blockage, Difficulty swallowing, Appendicitis or symptoms of appendicitis, A sudden change in bowel habits that lasts for longer than 2 weeks, Bleeding from the rectum.
effects: Although fibo sachet is a herbily formulated product, it may not be suitable for few people. Stomach cramping or bloating might occur in a few people, and it is the most common side-effect of this medication. If the feelings of gas or bloating persist or worsens, stop taking the medication and seek medical assistance.In severe constipation cases, a fibo sachet might not provide instant relief from constipation. It is better to observe for two days, and if the situation still does not get better, stop using the medication and pay a visit to the doctor.This product should be consumed with water or some other liquid to avoid the risk of choking. However, if you still feel choked after taking the product, seek medical assistance immediately.Feelings of nausea, vomiting and bloating are quite common with constipation, but these shall get better after a day or two. In case you still get those feelings after two days, stop using the product. Gas or stomach cramping may occur.

title: Lacasil 10G Sachet 1x8 (L)
details: Lacasil sachets contain an active ingredient "lactitol monohydrate" which is used for the treatment of chronic idiopathic constipation (CIC).
precautions: Keep it out of the reach of children. Store it below the room temperature i.e. below 25 degrees Celsius. Consult a doctor if you’re hypersensitive to any of its ingredients. Do not take overdose, always take it in a recommended dose.
effects: No side effects are reported. Consult a doctor if it causes digestive problems i.e. gas, bloating, abdominal pain, GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease), vomiting, nausea, or diarrhea, etc.

precautions: It is not recommended for patients who have a history of hypersensitivity to the active ingredient or any of the excipients specified. If your kid is allergic to simethicone, or in case if your child is suffering from any allergy, then do notify your doctor prior to using it. There is a possibility of the presence of inactive chemicals that causes issues or allergic reactions.For further information, talk to your doctor.Don't start, modify, or stop using any medicine without the doctor's consent.To discuss all the pharmaceutical products that you are using with your doctor, either prescribed or non-prescribed, either herbal or non-herbal.If your child takes this medication regularly and misses a dosage, give it to them immediately when you remember. If the next dose is approaching, then skip the missed dose. Give the next dose at the appropriate time each day. Do not increase the quantity of dose.Do not allow it to be frozen. Keep out of the bathroom. All drugs should be placed away from kids as well as animals.This medicine rarely causes any extreme allergic reaction; however, if any extreme allergic response is detected, seek medical treatment right once.Use with caution in patients with known hypersensitivity to the drug.

title: Clearlax 15MG Tab 1x30 (L)
details: This medicine is used to treat constipation.
precautions: Before taking it, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Take this medication by mouth with or without food, as directed by your doctor. If you are self-treating, follow all directions on the product package. If you are uncertain about any of the information, ask your doctor or pharmacist. Do not increase your dose, take it more frequently, or use it for a longer time than directed. Carefully measure the dose using a special measuring device/spoon. Do not use a household spoon because you may not get the correct dose. Ask your pharmacist or health care provider before using any medicine.
effects: Diarrhea in a large dosage may occur.

title: Pasmolax Oral 120ML Syp
details: This medication is used for relieve of abdominal distention due to excessive gas buildup.
precautions: Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of personal or family history of glaucoma (angle-closure type), overactive thyroid, other heart problems (e.g., coronary heart disease, congestive heart failure, fast heartbeat, arrhythmias), high blood pressure, kidney disease, heartburn problems (acid reflux, hiatal hernia), certain nervous system problem (autonomic neuropathy), myasthenia gravis. Antacids can interfere with the absorption of many other drugs. Be sure to check with your pharmacist before taking antacids with any other medication. Tell your doctor of any prescription or nonprescription medication your child may use, including any antacids or digestive medications since some combination products may also contain simethicone.
effects: This medication can cause nausea, constipation, diarrhea, or headache. If these symptoms persist or become severe, notify your doctor.

title: Iberogast 50ML Liquid
details: This product is used to relieve symptoms of extra gas caused by air swallowing or certain foods or infant formulas.
precautions: Please Consult Your Pharmacist or Physician
effects: Please Consult Your Pharmacist or Physician

title: Pro Colic Drops
details: It is used for Acute and chronic diarrhea, Gastroesophageal reflux in infant, Irritable bowel syndrome in adults and other conditions.
precautions: Before taking it, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Older adults should avoid taking probiotics. This is because this group is typically more sensitive to complications. Drink plenty of clear fluids to help prevent dehydration caused by diarrhea. This probiotic is safe for most healthy adults to use daily. Consult with your doctor and stop immediately if you experience side effects.
effects: In some cases, mild side effects might include an upset stomach, diarrhea, gas, and bloating for the first couple of days after you start taking them. They may also trigger allergic reactions.

precautions: Consult a doctor, if you're hypersensitive to any of its ingredients. Keep out of the reach of children. Protect from direct exposure to sunlight, and heat. Store below the room temperature.

title: Nucarb Tab 3x10 (L)
details: It is used to treat constipation.
precautions: Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of, Appendicitis or symptoms of appendicitis (such as nausea/vomiting, sudden or unexplained stomach/abdominal pain), a sudden change in bowel habits that lasts for longer than 2 weeks, Bleeding from the rectum, Intestinal blockage.
